summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a contractor, coordinating the final review and production of discovery materials, including an anonymizing index and cover letters, for defense counsel in a case. The materials involve redactions related to conditions of confinement for Tartaglione and emails regarding Touhy, and reference an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.context: Recipient of a discovery production cover letter from the US Attorney's Office.

persons.context: Referenced in emails under review; the psychologist was informed that Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring him.

connections.description: Email chains reference a news story about Tartaglione being questioned regarding an attack on Epstein, and Epstein informing a psychologist that Tartaglione discussed potentially injuring him.

events.title: Final Approval for Discovery Production
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel give final sign-off on cover letters and an anonymizing index for a discovery production to defense counsel.

events.title: Tartaglione Incident at MCC
events.description: Reference to a news story about Tartaglione being questioned regarding an attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and an email where Epstein informs a psychologist about Tartaglione's discussion of potentially injuring him.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office was preparing a discovery production for defense counsel, involving redactions related to inmate Tartaglione's conditions of confinement and emails regarding Touhy.
Email files under review contained references to a news story about Tartaglione being questioned in relation to an attack on Jeffrey Epstein while both were at the MCC.
One email chain included a report where Epstein informed a psychologist that Tartaglione had discussed potentially injuring him, but no guards' report was filed.

The production involved an anonymizing index and cover letters specifying that native/text files in a specific Bates range (SDNY_00008724 - SDNY_00013257) were confidential despite lacking a physical stamp.
The document workflow shows internal coordination on redaction decisions, with specific uncertainty about withholding information related to Tartaglione that also involved Epstein.
